newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Bahrain and Qatar agree to open embassies.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain and Qatar agree to open embassies.

text.p: Bahrain and Qatar on Sunday agreed to open embassies for the first time in an apparent attempt to improve strained relations between the two Gulf Arab states entangled in a territorial dispute.
"Manama and Doha agreed to set up embassies in both countries to further coordination and cooperation between them," Bahrain's official Gulf News Agency (GNA) said.
It said the agreement came during a meeting in Manama between Bahrain's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammad bin Mubarak al-Khalifa and his Qatari counterpart Sheikh Hamad bin Jassim bin Jabr al-Thani.
The Qatari foreign minister arrived in Manama earlier on Sunday in a bid to ease tensions between the countries.
GNA said he met Bahrain's Emir Sheikh Isa bin Sulman al-Khalifa and discussed "close relations between the two brotherly countries."
The territorial dispute is centred on Gulf islands controlled by Bahrain since the 1930s but also claimed by Qatar.

Relations between the two Gulf Arab allies worsened last year after Bahrain arrested, tried and later freed two Qataris on spy charges. Qatar also accused Bahrain of masterminding a foiled coup attempt in Doha last year.
Gulf Arab reconciliation efforts have failed to ease tensions between Manama and Doha.
